definitions: using high-sounding language lacking in meaning to impress people with false importance
examples: The politician gave a bombastic speech full of empty promises
His bombastic writing style alienated many thoughtful readers

definitions: having had the bones taken out during food preparation
showing clearly visible bone structure through skin or surface
examples: The chef prepared boned chicken breasts for easy eating
She bought boned fish fillets to make dinner preparation simpler
His boned fingers showed years of hard physical labor
The boned structure of her face gave her striking features

definitions: having no bones either naturally or through removal during preparation
examples: Boneless chicken wings are easier for children to eat
The restaurant specializes in boneless fish dishes for convenience

definitions: mad or crazy in an amusing, silly, or harmless way
examples: The crowd went bonkers when their team scored the winning goal
That bonkers idea actually turned out to be brilliant

definitions: attractive in appearance with a healthy, cheerful quality especially in Scottish usage
examples: She was a bonnie lass with rosy cheeks and bright eyes
The bonnie baby won everyone's hearts at the gathering

definitions: attractive in appearance with a healthy, cheerful quality especially in Scottish usage
examples: The bonny Scottish countryside stretched for miles around
Her bonny smile lit up the entire room

definitions: so thin that bones are prominently visible through the skin
having many small bones that make eating difficult
examples: His bony hands trembled as he reached for the cup
The old dog's bony frame showed years of hardship
This bony fish requires careful eating to avoid choking
The bony cut of meat needed slow cooking to soften

definitions: available to be reserved or scheduled in advance for future use
examples: The conference room is bookable through the online system
All bookable appointments for this week are already taken

definitions: having all available spaces or time slots already reserved
formally charged with a crime and processed by law enforcement
examples: The hotel is completely booked for the holiday weekend
Every table at the restaurant was booked months in advance
The suspect was booked on charges of theft last night
After being booked, he was released on bail

definitions: enjoying books and studying more than other activities often suggesting impractical knowledge
examples: Her bookish nature made her perfect for library work
The bookish professor rarely ventured outside his study

definitions: making a loud, deep, resonant sound that carries far
experiencing rapid growth, expansion, or economic success
examples: His booming voice could be heard across the entire hall
The booming thunder shook the windows of the house
The booming tech industry created thousands of new jobs
Business was booming after they launched their new product

definitions: helpful, useful, or beneficial in a way that is very welcome
examples: The new software proved a boon companion for remote workers
Rain was a boon blessing after months of drought

definitions: having boots on one's feet as footwear
forcibly ejected or removed from a place or position
examples: The booted hikers were ready for the mountain trail
Booted workers trudged through the muddy construction site
He was booted from the club for causing trouble
The company booted several employees during restructuring

definitions: made, distributed, or sold illegally without official permission or license
examples: The police seized thousands of bootleg DVDs from the warehouse
Bootleg recordings of the concert spread quickly online

definitions: having a decorative or defining edge, boundary, or frame around something
examples: The bordered garden beds looked neat and well-maintained
She wore a silk scarf bordered with delicate gold thread

definitions: only just acceptable or adequate by the minimum standard
located at or near a dividing line between two conditions
examples: His borderline grades put his scholarship at risk
The movie received borderline reviews from most critics
The patient's borderline symptoms made diagnosis difficult
She exhibited borderline personality traits requiring careful monitoring

definitions: relating to the cold northern regions characterized by coniferous forests
examples: Boreal forests cover vast areas of Canada and Russia
The boreal climate supports unique wildlife adapted to cold

definitions: feeling tired and impatient because something is uninteresting or repetitive
examples: The bored students stared out the window during class
She felt bored after finishing all her work early

definitions: fond of giving orders in an annoying way to control others
examples: Her bossy attitude made it difficult to work with her
The bossy child always insisted on choosing the games

definitions: relating to the scientific study of plants or plant life
examples: The botanic research revealed new medicinal properties in herbs
She studied botanic illustrations from the nineteenth century

definitions: relating to the scientific study of plants or derived from plants
examples: The botanical garden displayed rare species from around the world
These botanical extracts are used in natural skincare products

definitions: carried out badly or carelessly resulting in failure or poor quality
examples: The botched surgery left the patient with permanent damage
His botched attempt at repair made the problem worse

definitions: feeling anxious, worried, or concerned about something
feeling annoyed, disturbed, or made uncomfortable by something
examples: She seemed bothered by the unexpected change in plans
He was clearly bothered about the test results
The loud music bothered neighbors trying to sleep
Don't be bothered by their negative comments

definitions: having a particular type of bottom or base as foundation
examples: The flat bottomed boat was perfect for shallow rivers
The round bottomed flask sat securely in its holder

definitions: so deep that the bottom cannot be seen or reached
seeming to have no limit in quantity or extent
examples: The divers explored the seemingly bottomless ocean trench
She stared into the bottomless pit with growing fear
The restaurant offered bottomless coffee refills with breakfast
His bottomless appetite amazed everyone at the buffet

definitions: moving up and down repeatedly with elastic force
showing vigorous health and cheerful liveliness
examples: The bouncing ball rolled down the stairs noisily
Children were bouncing on the trampoline all afternoon
The bouncing baby giggled with delight at everything
She arrived with bouncing energy despite the long flight

definitions: able to bounce well or having a springy quality
full of energy and cheerful enthusiasm
examples: The bouncy castle was popular at the children's party
These bouncy tennis balls are perfect for beginners
Her bouncy personality made her perfect for customer service
The bouncy music got everyone dancing at the wedding

definitions: tied or secured with rope, cord, or similar restraint
certain or extremely likely to happen inevitably
going or ready to go towards a particular place
examples: The bound prisoner struggled against the tight ropes
Ancient books were bound in leather for durability
You're bound to succeed with such dedication
Mistakes are bound to happen when learning something new
The ship was bound for distant shores
All northbound trains are running late today

definitions: having a boundary or limit that clearly defines the extent
examples: The bounded area was marked with yellow tape
Their authority is bounded by strict legal regulations

definitions: having no boundaries or limits in extent, size, or amount
examples: Her boundless enthusiasm inspired the entire team to excel
The universe seems boundless to human understanding

definitions: large in quantity and given or provided generously
examples: The bountiful harvest fed the village through winter
Nature's bountiful gifts should be cherished and protected

definitions: belonging to or characteristic of the middle class with conventional attitudes and materialistic values
examples: His bourgeois lifestyle centered on accumulating material possessions
The artist rejected bourgeois values in favor of bohemian freedom

definitions: of, relating to, or affecting cattle or similar animals
showing little intelligence or animation like cattle
examples: The veterinarian specialized in bovine diseases and treatments
Bovine products include milk, meat, and leather
His bovine expression showed no understanding of the joke
She stared with bovine indifference at the exciting news

definitions: having a curved or bent shape often from pressure
bent forward as a gesture of respect or greeting
examples: The bowed branches nearly touched the ground with fruit
Years of hard work left him with bowed shoulders
The bowed heads showed reverence during the ceremony
They stood with bowed heads in silent remembrance

definitions: bending the body forward as a sign of respect or greeting
bending or curving downward under weight or pressure
examples: The bowing performers acknowledged the thunderous applause
Bowing etiquette varies significantly between different cultures
The bowing shelves needed reinforcement to hold more books
Trees were bowing under the weight of heavy snow

definitions: placed or packaged inside a box or container
trapped in a confined space with limited options
examples: The boxed chocolates made a perfect gift
All items were carefully boxed before shipping
He felt boxed in by his limited career options
The boxed canyon offered no escape route

definitions: having a square, angular shape lacking curves or elegance
examples: The boxy design of the car maximized interior space
Her boxy jacket made her look broader than she was

definitions: having qualities associated with boys such as playfulness and youthful appearance
examples: His boyish charm made him popular despite his age
She had a boyish haircut that suited her active lifestyle

definitions: reinforced or supported with a brace or similar device
prepared mentally or physically for something difficult
examples: The braced wall could withstand strong winds
Her braced leg healed properly after the surgery
They braced themselves for bad news from the doctor
The crew braced for impact as waves hit the ship

definitions: fresh and invigorating in a way that makes one feel energetic
serving to brace or support something structurally
examples: The bracing sea air cleared her mind instantly
A bracing walk in cold weather woke him up
The bracing beams prevented the tunnel from collapsing
Additional bracing supports were added for safety

definitions: containing salt but less salty than seawater typically where freshwater meets ocean
examples: Brackish water in the estuary supports unique wildlife
The brackish taste indicated the well was too close to the sea

definitions: excellent or first-rate deserving to be boasted about
examples: That was a brag performance worthy of championship
His brag fishing spot always yielded the biggest catches

definitions: talking with excessive pride about one's achievements or possessions
examples: His constant bragging about wealth annoyed his colleagues
The bragging winner couldn't stop talking about her victory

definitions: formed by interweaving three or more strands of hair, rope, or material
examples: Her braided hair stayed neat during the long hike
The braided rope was stronger than single strands

definitions: subjected to systematic pressure to adopt radically different beliefs against one's will
examples: The brainwashed prisoners couldn't remember their former beliefs
Some worried the students were being brainwashed by propaganda

definitions: having or showing exceptional intelligence and mental ability
examples: The brainy student solved complex equations with ease
Her brainy approach to problems impressed the entire team

definitions: cooked slowly in liquid with the pot covered after browning
examples: The braised beef was tender enough to cut with a fork
Braised vegetables retained more flavor than boiled ones

definitions: having branches or divided into smaller parts from main structure
examples: The branched tree provided shade over a wide area
The branched river system irrigated the entire valley

definitions: extending outward by dividing into two or more parts from main structure
examples: The branching paths in the garden created interesting walks
Branching coral formations sheltered diverse marine life

definitions: marked with a trademark or identifying symbol of manufacturer
stigmatized or marked negatively in public perception
examples: She only wore branded clothing from luxury designers
The branded cattle could be identified from a distance
He was branded a troublemaker after one incident
The company was branded unreliable by consumer reports
